De Hartenkoningin (The Queen of Hearts) is an educational game with different maths games such as: addition, subtraction, grinding tables, surface area...

For Example:
You roll the three dice, look witch numbers you rolled. Afterwards you can choose in witch order you want to place them and then you can begin to add up to 100 or to subtract to 0. The player who gets to 100 or 0 first is the winner and wins a heart.

You choose for yourself or with your partner how you want to  play this game.

There are 5 different game suggestions in the box. Other games can be downloaded from the Website.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fallen Land: A Post Apocalyptic Board Game – 2nd Edition
Description:
Can you survive the aftermath of a nuclear and biological apocalypse?  You are the leader of a faction of survivors competing against others for primacy.  Assemble and equip your party, then set out to explore the wastes, claim resources, and actualize your agenda.  Build and manage your town to protect your citizens and resources.  Make and break treaties to navigate your way through the minefield of bribery, betrayal, and hubris of the other players.

Fallen Land is set in the ruinous aftermath of post-apocalyptic America and is a thematic board game for 1-6 players.  Featuring sandbox-style game play, it combines the elements of a strategy board game with card building and role playing.  Driven by macabre stories of a world gone mad, players must adapt to the ever-changing variables: the cards, stories, interactions, and other threats.

The second edition contains 757 cards compared to 540 in the first edition. The map now includes Canada and Mexico. It also contains expansions there were previously released separately - Fallen Land: A Journey into Darkness and Fallen Land: Outriders Trading Post.

-description from Kickstarter campaign page

Name: Code België
Description:
Code België (Code Belgium), is an educational game that helps children placing links between certain topics such as: important people, counties, rivers...

This game is an expansion of the original game codenames.

How to win the game? First of all, there are two teams (red and blue) with two leaders. On the table there are 25 cards set out. The leaders get to see a plan of the board(card) with their colors on it. The idea is that they link their colors by giving their team members a subject and the number of cards they have to guess.

If it's correct the leader places the color of his team on the card. If it's the card of the other team otherwise or if it's the bomb GAME OVER! The team who collects all his cards wins the game.

Name: Code Europa
Description:
Code Europa (Code Europe) is an educational game that helps children placing links between certain topics such as: important people, counties, rivers...

This game is an expansion of the original game codenames.

How to win the game? First of all, there are two teams (red and blue) with two leaders. On the table there are 25 cards set out. The leaders get to see a plan of the board(card) with their colors on it. The idea is that they link their colors by giving their team members a subject and the number of cards they have to guess.

If it's correct the leader places the color of his team on the card. If it's the card of the other team otherwise or if it's the bomb GAME OVER! The team who collects all his cards wins the game.

-description from publisher

Name: WO I & WO II
Description:
Code WO I & WO II (World War I & World War II) is an educational game that helps children placing links between certain topics such as: countries, events, important people...

This game is an expansion of the original game codenames.

How to win the game? First of all, there are two teams (red and blue) with two leaders. On the table there are 25 cards set out. The leaders get to see a plan of the board(card) with their colors on it. The idea is that they link their colors by giving their team members a subject and the number of cards they have to guess.

If it's correct the leader places the color of his team on the card. If it's the card of the other team otherwise or if it's the bomb GAME OVER! The team who collects all his cards wins the game.

-description from publisher

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Return of Ripsnarl
Description:
A new scenario for Battle for Greyport.

The Scenario comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 1

This scenario comes in two flavours of difficulty so both introductory and seasoned players should find a good time.

The Return of Ripsnarl! (For new players)
- Use the "Blood Moon Rising" scenario from the game, with the following changes:
- At the start of the game, after drawing opening hands, each player puts a Dragon Breath Ale promo card into their hand, for a total of 7 cards.
- Encounter 1 takes place at The Red Dragon Inn instead of the Dwarven Ruins.
- Encounter 2: During setup, each player gets a Doomwolf promo instead of a Werewolf. The Doomwolf's 2 threat counts towards each player's total threat. If Greyport City Hall is destroyed, each player gets a Werewolf as normal (not a Doomwolf.)
- Enounter 3: Use Werewolf tokens as normal. Ripsnarl has 20, 30, 35 or 45 HP for 2, 3, 4 or 5 players, respectively.
- Recommended rest healing: 2

The Return of Ripsnarl! (Advanced players)
- Use the "Blood Moon Rising" scenario from the game, with the following changes:
- At the start of the game, after drawing opening hands, each player puts a Dragon Breath Ale promo card into their hand, for a total of 7 cards.
- Encounter 1 takes place at The Red Dragon Inn instead of the Dwarven Ruins.
- Encounter 2: During setup, each player gets a Doomwolf promo instead of a Werewolf. The Doomwolf's 2 threat does not counts towards each player's total threat. If Greyport City Hall is destroyed, each player gets a Werewolf as normal (not a Doomwolf.)
- Enounter 3: Use Werewolf tokens as normal. Ripsnarl is Ranged (Use this card as a reminder.)
- Recommended rest healing: 1
RANGED

Name: Tea Time
Description:
Tea Time is an educational game to help children to collect ingredients to make their recipe.

How to play this game? The meaning of this game is to collect as first all the ingredients for your dessert. Each player receives a dessert and 5 ingredients in their hands at the start. The dessert is placed on the table in front of you. The remaining cards form the pile, the top card is turned over as the discard pile.

The player takes a card from the pile or puts it on the discard pile if he doesn't need it for his dessert. The player can also play an action card (bulbs) or put the ingredient next to their dessert if they match. Pick a new card until you have 5 cards in your hands.

The player who first collects all the ingredients for their dessert wins the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Liefde is... samen een spelletje spelen
Description:
'Liefde is ... samen een spelletje spelen' is Dutch for 'Love is ... playing a game together'.

You earn points ('hearts'), by guessing what answer another player gave to one of the personal questions on the game cards.

Some sample questions are 

     On my first date I always want ....
     For a romantic weekend in my own country, I prefer to go to ....
     In my previous life, I most likely was ....


The other players can randomly shout their answers, for 30 seconds.

Name: Ogres Eleven: The Fantasy Heist Game
Description:
The crew is getting back together, Frank Ogre has one final grudge to settle and this time it's personal.

Play as one of eleven characters in this "Dungeons and Dragons"- inspired heist game.

Co-operatively plan your heist, utilising Fantasy Con-Artists, Lockpickers, Hired Muscle and Masterminds. Plant distractions, hack alarms and solicit bribes before attempting the job. Only the most devious players will stand any chance against the Central Bank and its monstrous Chairman!

Plan your heist carefully in the first phase of the game, marking out secret objectives to complete throughout the game to earn skill points and extra cash.

Be careful not to raise your "heat" too much- or the vault will be sealed and the heist will end dismally. Players win only when the vault is emptied and their character has successfully pulled off a secret win condition.

Ogre's Eleven uses a "legacy play" system that changes the heist each time you attempt it. With eleven playable characters, dozens of different skills/items, new patrol routes and changing security systems- even veteran players will come back over and over again to set new high scores and compete against their friends.
